sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
Find the solution of the following system of equations using Gaussian elimination method:

2x + 3y + z = 7

x - 2y + 4z = -5

3x - y - z = 6
message_2:
To solve the system of equations using Gaussian elimination, we first need to form an augmented matrix:

| 2  3  1 |  7 |
| 1 -2  4 | -5 |
| 3 -1 -1 |  6 |

Step 1: Swap Row 1 and Row 2 to have a 1 in the top left corner.

| 1 -2  4 | -5 |
| 2  3  1 |  7 |
| 3 -1 -1 |  6 |

Step 2: Eliminate the 2 and 3 below the 1 in the first column. To do this, replace Row 2 with (-2 * Row 1) + Row 2 and replace Row 3 with (-3 * Row 1) + Row 3.

| 1 -2  4 | -5 |
| 0  7 -7 | 17 |
| 0  5 -11| 21 |

Step 3: Divide Row 2 by 7 to get a 1 in the second row and second column.

| 1 -2  4 | -5 |
| 0  1 -1 | 17/7 |
| 0  5 -11| 21 |

Step 4: Eliminate the 5 below the 1 in the second column. To do this, replace Row 3 with (-5 * Row 2) + Row 3.

| 1 -2  4 | -5 |
| 0  1 -1 | 17/7 |
| 0  0  6 | 16/7 |

Step 5: Divide Row 3 by 6 to get a 1 in the third row and third column.

| 1 -2  4 | -5 |
| 0  1 -1 | 17/7 |
| 0  0  1 | 8/21 |

Step 6: Use back-substitution to find the values of x, y, and z. Start with the last row and work upwards.

z = 8/21

y = 17/7 + z = 17/7 + 8/21 = (51 + 8)/21 = 59/21

x = -5 + 2y - 4z = -5 + 2(59/21) - 4(8/21) = (-105 + 118 - 32)/21 = -19/21

So, the solution to the system of equations is:

x = -19/21
y = 59/21
z = 8/21
